code_quality.details: Good naming conventions and meaningful variable names. Clean separation with routes/todo.js, database/database.js, and app.js. Proper error handling with try/catch and Sentry integration, correct HTTP status codes (422, 404, 500). Some console.log statements remain (e.g. 'someone hit the root endpoint', 'creating todo'). No eval() or hardcoded secrets — env vars used properly via dotenv and Sentry DSN. Swagger served from static JSON file. Minor: helper functions (toObj/toArray) are defined inline in routes rather than extracted to a utility module.

documentation.details: Excellent README with badges (CI, Coverage, Quality Gate), clear feature list, stack description, installation instructions, test commands, and CI/CD pipeline explanation. Swagger UI active at /api-docs. JSDoc comments on all route handlers explaining purpose and behavior. Good setup instructions with prerequisites and commands.

teams.summary: Solid project with Sentry observability, clean CRUD routes, and comprehensive README. Code is well-structured with proper error handling. Minor cleanup needed on console.logs and helper extraction.
tips: Extract toObj/toArray helpers into a shared utils module to reduce duplication
Remove or guard console.log statements behind a proper logger (like winston or pino) for production
Name your PRs with conventional commit format (feat: xxx, fix: xxx) — squash merges use the PR title as the commit message

code_quality.details: Excellent code organization: helpers extracted to utils/helpers.js with JSDoc, routes cleanly separated, database module with resetDb() for testing. Helmet and morgan for security/logging. Global error handler properly defined. Husky + commitlint for commit quality. No console.logs in routes (uses next(err) pattern). No eval(), no hardcoded secrets. .env.example provided. Only minor issue: a stray 'package/index.js' file (test-exclude library code) appears committed by accident.

documentation.details: Outstanding README with multiple badges, table of contents, detailed API reference with request/response examples, environment variable documentation, Docker instructions, security section, and project structure overview. Swagger UI active with swagger-jsdoc annotations on every route including full schema definitions. .env.example included. Scripts documented in a table.

teams.summary: Top-tier project. Clean architecture with proper middleware (helmet, morgan), extracted helpers with JSDoc, error forwarding via next(), and an exceptionally detailed README. One of the strongest submissions.
tips: Remove the accidental 'package/' directory (contains test-exclude library source code, not your code)
Consider adding rate limiting for production readiness
Name your PRs with conventional commit format (feat: xxx, fix: xxx) — squash merges use the PR title as the commit message

code_quality.details: Good use of Zod for input validation (querySchema, idSchema, todoSchema) — a step above most teams. Winston logger properly configured. Morgan for HTTP logging. Swagger with swagger-jsdoc. However: /debug endpoint exists (gated by NODE_ENV=development but still risky), error.log file committed to repo. app.listen() called unconditionally in app.js (breaks test isolation). Some console.error still present alongside logger. No helmet for security headers.

documentation.details: Very good README with multiple badges (Quality Gate, Coverage, Uptime), stack description, security tools listed (CodeQL, Trivy, Dependabot, SonarCloud, Morgan). Installation and Docker instructions present. .env.example provided. Swagger UI documented. Could benefit from API endpoint table and response examples.

teams.summary: Strong validation with Zod and good observability (winston + morgan). The /debug endpoint and unconditional app.listen() are the main issues. Good security tooling integration in CI.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — it exposes environment variables and secrets
Guard app.listen() with a check (if require.main === module or NODE_ENV !== 'test') for proper test isolation
Add helmet middleware for security headers

code_quality.details: Clean, well-structured code. Helmet for security. Swagger via swagger-jsdoc with proper JSDoc annotations. Helpers properly extracted to utils/helpers.js. Global error handler. Server start gated by require.main === module. DB_PATH configurable via env var. No eval(), no hardcoded secrets. No debug endpoint. Routes lack try/catch (errors fall through to global handler which is acceptable but less explicit). Swagger config duplicated between swagger.js and app.js.

documentation.details: Comprehensive README with table of contents, stack overview, prerequisites, installation, env vars table, Docker instructions with GHCR pull command, endpoints table with curl examples, and Swagger UI mentioned. .env.example provided. CI/CD section explains the full pipeline with multiple workflows.

teams.summary: Well-polished project with helmet, proper server gating, and a thorough README. Multiple CI workflows (develop, main, release, rollback, matrix) show advanced CI/CD understanding. Minor swagger config duplication.
tips: Remove the duplicate swagger.js file — the config is already in app.js
Add try/catch in route handlers for more explicit error responses instead of relying solely on the global handler
Add a .env.example with all variables documented

code_quality.details: Good code with detailed JSDoc comments on every function. Parameterized queries explicitly noted. formatTodo/formatTodos helpers for consistent output. esbuild for production bundling. Coverage merge script and verification script show advanced CI understanding. Kubernetes manifests (k8s/) show deployment maturity. However: /debug endpoint still present (gated by NODE_ENV but exposes secrets). productionLazyImport wrapper is unnecessarily complex — a simple if statement suffices. Swagger served from static JSON rather than generated.

documentation.details: Good README with features list, prerequisites, installation, testing, Docker instructions, API reference with curl examples, and endpoint documentation. However, README could benefit from badges, env vars table, and CI/CD pipeline description. No .env.example file.

teams.summary: Strong technical depth with K8s manifests, esbuild bundling, and coverage merge tooling. The /debug endpoint and lack of .env.example are the main gaps. Good JSDoc coverage.
tips: Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — it exposes environment variables and secrets
Add a .env.example file so others know which env vars are needed
Simplify the productionLazyImport pattern — a plain if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== 'production') block is clearer

code_quality.details: Clean app/server separation (app.js + server.js). Swagger spec defined as a full JSON object in swagger.js — thorough but verbose. Routes are functional but lack try/catch error handling — any database error will crash. Helper functions (toObj/toArray) defined inline in routes/todo.js. Search endpoint defined after /:id which causes routing conflicts (GET /todos/search/all will match /:id first). No helmet, no logging middleware. Prettier configured.

documentation.details: Very minimal README — just 'a todo api' with run command, Swagger UI link, and a coverage badge. No installation instructions beyond npm install/start. No env vars documentation. No API endpoints listed. No Docker instructions. No project structure. The Swagger spec itself is thorough but the README is far too sparse.

teams.summary: Functional API with thorough Swagger spec, but the README is nearly empty and routes lack error handling. Search endpoint has a routing conflict. Missing security middleware.
tips: Update your README with real setup instructions, API docs, and badges
Add try/catch in all route handlers to prevent unhandled crashes
Move the search route before /:id to avoid routing conflicts, or restructure the route path

code_quality.details: Modern ES modules throughout. Clean code with good comments. Scalar API reference instead of standard swagger-ui (nice touch). Vitest for testing. Debug endpoint properly gated by NODE_ENV. dotenv.config with quiet option. esbuild config for builds. .env.example provided. Compose file included. No try/catch in routes (errors not caught). console.log statements remain in routes. Routes well-structured with proper HTTP codes.

documentation.details: Excellent README with CI/CD badges, table of contents, prerequisites, getting started, env vars table, Docker with GHCR pull instructions, full API reference with curl examples and response bodies, and CI/CD pipeline description. .env.example provided. Swagger UI via Scalar at /api-docs.

teams.summary: Modern, well-documented project using ES modules and Scalar for API docs. Good CI/CD with separate CI and CD workflows. Minor issues: missing try/catch in routes and leftover console.logs.
tips: Add try/catch in route handlers to return proper 500 responses instead of crashing
Replace console.log with a structured logger (pino or winston) for production
Remove or protect the /debug endpoint — it exposes environment variables and secrets

code_quality.details: Exceptional code quality. ES modules, Zod validation on all inputs (create, update, pagination, search) with proper error responses. Helmet, morgan, rate limiting, CORS, and request ID middleware. Async database with fs/promises. Proper global error handler with env-aware error messages. Husky pre-commit and pre-push hooks. No debug endpoint. No console.logs in production code. No eval(), no hardcoded secrets. Clean separation of concerns. Release-please for versioning. pnpm as package manager.

documentation.details: Excellent README with badges, stack description, complete setup guide (clone, install, env, Docker), comprehensive env vars table with descriptions and defaults. Commands table. API endpoints table. Environments section. teams.summary: The gold standard submission. Production-ready with rate limiting, request IDs, CORS, helmet, Zod validation, async file I/O, and comprehensive Swagger docs. Excellent CI/CD with release-please, reusable deploy workflow, and husky hooks.

code_quality.details: Good separation with app.js, server.js, routes, database, and docs folders. Sentry integration. Swagger via swagger-jsdoc with route annotations. Proper error handling with try/catch in all routes. Uses node: protocol for imports (modern). DB_PASSWORD env var checked with warning. However: .env file loading by NODE_ENV is unusual and error-prone. Sentry init before dotenv means DSN might not be loaded. console.log/console.error still present. Helpers (toObj/toArray) defined inline in routes.

documentation.details: Very impressive README with extensive badges (coverage, quality gate, uptime, duplicated lines, vulnerabilities, maintainability). UptimeRobot monitoring.

code_quality.details: Good separation with routes/utils.js extracting toArray, formatTodo, formatTodos. JSDoc on all functions. Try/catch with dedicated handleRouteError/handleAppRouteError functions. Swagger loaded from YAML file with CDN assets for Vercel. .env.example provided. However: /debug endpoint exists and exposes process.env (not just SECRET_KEY) — returns full env object which is a security risk even gated by NODE_ENV. api/index.js is just a re-export. Verbose formatTodo/formatTodos could use object destructuring.

documentation.details: README has badges and basic structure description, but is duplicated (same content appears twice). Endpoints listed but without examples. Setup instructions present but brief. No Docker instructions. Swagger available via YAML file. 'Suggestions / prochaines étapes' section suggests features aren't implemented yet, which reads as incomplete.

teams.summary: Decent code with proper error handling and helper extraction. The /debug endpoint leaking full process.env is a significant security concern. README is duplicated and reads as unfinished.
tips: CRITICAL: The /debug endpoint exposes the full process.env object — restrict it to specific keys or remove it entirely
Fix the duplicated README content — the same text appears twice
Simplify formatTodo with object destructuring: const { id, title, description, status } = todo; return { id, title, description, status };

code_quality.details: Excellent architecture: ES modules, config/ folder for helmet and swagger, helpers/ for utils, routes/schemas/ for Zod validation schemas. Clean validate() helper function. Every file has JSDoc. Helmet with strict CSP. Proper separation of app.js and main.js. No debug endpoint. No console.logs in app routes (only in catch blocks). resetForTesting() in database for test isolation. Renovate for dependency management. formatTodo for consistent API output. Only minor: helmet middleware applied after routes in app.js (should be before).

documentation.details: Thorough README with badges, tech table with versions, complete local deployment guide, env vars documentation, all scripts listed in a table, project structure description, and Swagger UI link. .env.example provided. Swagger generated from JSDocs with proper component schemas. Clear and well-organized.

teams.summary: Very clean, well-architected project with Zod validation schemas, helmet CSP, renovate, and proper ES modules. Strong documentation. Minor middleware ordering issue with helmet.
tips: Move app.use(helmetMiddleware) before route definitions so security headers apply to all responses
